commit_message:
Nested Quota Driver: Create column allocated in Quota table

To represent the quotas allocated for the immediate child
projects we need to create a new column,"allocated" in Quota
table, that will be the sum of the "hard_limit" values of
the immediate child projects.

Co-Authored-By: Sajeesh CS <sajeesh.cs@cern.ch>
Co-Authored-By: Vinod Kumar <vinod.kumar.boppanna@cern.ch>
Co-Authored-By: Erickson Santos <erickson@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Raildo Mascena <raildo@lsd.ufcg.edu.br>
Co-Authored-By: Vilobh Meshram <vilobhmm@yahoo-inc.com>

Change-Id: I6ec0aa2322b50a85d1eec2d3707650e7dc53f8c3
Partially Implements:  bp nested-quota-driver-api

See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from sqlalchemy import Column from sqlalchemy import Integer from sqlalchemy import MetaData from sqlalchemy import Table def upgrade(migrate_engine): meta = MetaData() meta.bind = migrate_engine # Add a new column metrics to save metrics info for compute nodes quotas = Table('quotas', meta, autoload=True) shadow_quotas = Table('shadow_quotas', meta, autoload=True) allocated = Column('allocated', Integer, default=0) shadow_allocated = Column('allocated', Integer, default=0) quotas.create_column(allocated) shadow_quotas.create_column(shadow_allocated) def downgrade(migrate_engine): meta = MetaData() meta.bind = migrate_engine # Remove the new column quotas = Table('quotas', meta, autoload=True) shadow_quotas = Table('shadow_quotas', meta, autoload=True) quotas.drop_column('allocated') shadow_quotas.drop_column('allocated')

subject: Fix Transition to SIGUSR2 in oslo.reports breaks upgrade
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-30 02:02:00.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.reports/commit/a811e4a00dec19f88d4f543ebcd2253ad82ca3b9', 'message': 'Fix Transition to SIGUSR2 in oslo.reports breaks upgrade

In I9d3b6079ba2cca41fe4723723a6f80b2c3c0b9c0, we broke backward
compatability when we switched from SIGUSR1 to SIGUSR2. This breaks
grenade jobs (Example https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238479/).

So, let us allow a config option for operators to specify which
signal we should be handling for each service (depending on whether
it is running under mod_wsgi or not). By default we should just
handle both SIGUSR1 and SIGUSR2 to ensure both eventlet and
mod_wsgi scenarios are supported.

Closes-Bug: #1510740
Change-Id: I54ba70557f441fbd10eb085f79d594a9a33e1f11
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-11-02 12:57:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/oslo.reports/commit/47eb662c7c733e444dcce387beab0f491f6016d8', 'message': "Fix Transition to SIGUSR2 in oslo.reports breaks upgrade

In I9d3b6079ba2cca41fe4723723a6f80b2c3c0b9c0, we broke backward
compatability when we switched from SIGUSR1 to SIGUSR2. This breaks
grenade jobs (Example https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238479/).

So for now, let's register both SIGUSR1 and SIGUSR2 and trigger a
warning in the log that SIGUSR1 has been deprecated. We should
remove use of SIGUSR1 in the O release. Hopefully this does not
break anything as when running under mod_wsgi SIGUSR1 is just
ignored (and SIGUSR2 will work) and both signals will work
under eventlet.

Closes-Bug: #1510740
Change-Id: I54ba70557f441fbd10eb085f79d594a9a33e1f11

commit_message:
Fix Transition to SIGUSR2 in oslo.reports breaks upgrade

In I9d3b6079ba2cca41fe4723723a6f80b2c3c0b9c0, we broke backward
compatability when we switched from SIGUSR1 to SIGUSR2. This breaks
grenade jobs (Example https://review.openstack.org/#/c/238479/).

So for now, let's register both SIGUSR1 and SIGUSR2 and trigger a
warning in the log that SIGUSR1 has been deprecated. We should
remove use of SIGUSR1 in the O release. Hopefully this does not
break anything as when running under mod_wsgi SIGUSR1 is just
ignored (and SIGUSR2 will work) and both signals will work
under eventlet.

Closes-Bug: #1510740
Change-Id: I54ba70557f441fbd10eb085f79d594a9a33e1f11

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/50/241850/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: How this book is organized ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This book examines some of the most common uses for OpenStack clouds, and explains the considerations for each use case. Cloud architects may use this book as a comprehensive guide by reading all of the use cases, but it is also possible to review only the chapters which pertain to a specific use case. The use cases covered in this guide include: * General purpose : Uses common components that address 80% of common use cases. * Compute focused: For compute intensive workloads such as high performance computing (HPC). * Storage focused: For storage intensive workloads such as data analytics with parallel file systems. * Network focused: For high performance and reliable networking, such as a content delivery network (CDN). * Multi-site: For applications that require multiple site deployments for geographical, reliability or data locality reasons. * Hybrid cloud: Uses multiple disparate clouds connected either for failover, hybrid cloud bursting, or availability. * Massively scalable: For cloud service providers or other large installations. * Specialized cases: Architectures that have not previously been covered in the defined use cases. .. TODO Add cross-references to chapters after the files have been converted

commit_message:
[Reports] Switch task HTML report to Jinja2 templates

This is another step to complete usage of Jinja2 instead of Mako.
There are no features or refactoring within this patch, just switch
to another template engine.

Changes:
  * added template `base.html' as Jinja2 replacement of base.mako
    (which will be removed after the rest of templates are
    switched to base.html)
  * report.mako is replaced with report.html (Jinja2)

Change-Id: Ib4212a3e761597f5005dc1f19765713f1681cd16

deleted_lines: last_time = nil errors = 0evaltrace = false # last line. exit this file! if ($LAST_READ_LINE =~ /Finished catalog run in (\S+) seconds/) total = $1.to_f break end unless evaltrace evaltrace = true puts "Evaltrace found!" log = [] end # if we use evaltrace don't do normal parsing next if evaltrace # a puppet line with time if ($LAST_READ_LINE =~ /^(\S+)\s+(\S+)\s+\((.*?)\)/) time = Time.parse $1 level = $2 message = $3 # set duration of this line if last_time duration = time - last_time else duration = 0.0 end last_time = time # line with resource if (message =~ /.*\/([A-Z0-9][0-9A-Za-z_]+)\[(.*)\]/) type = $1.to_sym title = $2 log << { :time => time, :message => message, :level => level, :duration => duration, :number => $INPUT_LINE_NUMBER, :type => type, :title => title } if (level == 'err:') errors += 1 end # line processed next end # line did not match next end # end line with time if errors > 0 puts "Errors: #{errors}" end

commit_message:
Use separate queue for agent state reports.

This optimization is needed for big clusters with hundreds
of agents where the spike of activity may trigger a burst
of RPC requests that would prevent neutron-server from processing
agent heart beats in time, triggering resource rescheduling.

This will be further optimized by running dedicated RPC workers
for state reports processing.

Related-Bug: #1496410
Change-Id: Id86a1f962aaa4f64011d57ae55d240f890cca4f7
(cherry picked from commit 7267d75fdd3f90af759d71e9490cd41d41ba6d98)

revisions:

commit_message:
Add retries to get_domain_id

* Allow API client to try several times
  if domain was not found in keystone

Change-Id: I10f171401fb973456ff4c78d635cf112b3320f37
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat refs/changes/03/173403/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: RETRY_COUNT = 10 RETRY_SLEEP = 3 RETRY_COUNT.times do token = authenticate domains = find_domain_by_name(token) if domains.length == 1 return domains[0]['id'] elsif domains.length > 1 name = domains[0]['name'] raise KeystoneAPIError, "Found multiple matches for domain name: '#{name}'" else sleep RETRY_SLEEP end raise KeystoneAPIError, "Unable to find domain with name: '#{@resource[:domain_name]}'"
deleted_lines: token = authenticate domains = find_domain_by_name(token) if domains.length == 1 return domains[0]['id'] elsif domains.length > 1 name = domains[0]['name'] raise KeystoneAPIError, 'Found multiple matches for domain name "#{name}"' else raise KeystoneAPIError, 'Unable to find matching domain'

commit_message:
Fix start_zookeeper on ubuntu.

Function 'start_zookeeper' when zookeeperd is running returns failure instead of success breaking execution of stack.sh.

Change-Id: I73a2d6d67d38a003eac229f581e00430cb684879
Closes-Bug: 1513741
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/48/242448/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: start_service zookeeper && return 0 # Bug LP #1513741: on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS if zookeeper is running # then start_service would fail if is_ubuntu; then sudo service zookeeper status | grep running && return 0 fi return 1

subject: Port signature_utils to Python 3
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-22 14:56:58.000000000', 'files': ['glance/common/signature_utils.py', 'glance/tests/unit/common/test_signature_utils.py', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/glance/commit/43178a29e5e105c7cf54b9322483e981236a84ae', 'message': "Port signature_utils to Python 3

* Catch also binascii.Error when decoding Base64: Python 3 raises
  binascii.Error, not TypeError.
* Replace base64.b64decode() with base64.decode_as_bytes() to get
  accept also Unicode.
* verify_signature(): encode checksum_hash to UTF-8 if it's Unicode.
* Fix test_signature_utils: use byte strings
* tox.ini: add glance.tests.unit.common.test_signature_utils

Change-Id: I386892f3e28f9454a438e414730318ec3f771342
"}]
commit_message:
Port signature_utils to Python 3

* Catch also binascii.Error when decoding Base64: Python 3 raises
  binascii.Error, not TypeError.
* Replace base64.b64decode() with base64.decode_as_bytes() to get
  accept also Unicode.
* verify_signature(): encode checksum_hash to UTF-8 if it's Unicode.
* Fix test_signature_utils: use byte strings
* tox.ini: add glance.tests.unit.common.test_signature_utils

Change-Id: I386892f3e28f9454a438e414730318ec3f771342
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/53/238553/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Validate arguments for command rally verify compare

Running 'rally verify compare' command, if uuid is empty, it will
gives a unfriendly message.
This patch validate uuid agrument, and raise a friendly message
when meets an exception.

Closes-Bug: #1512707
Change-Id: Ibb6cb0b16a1d4871ac1ff229e5dd67606e3541e0
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/04/242004/6 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Allow Orchestration of Image Backend

Adds a horizon::image_backend parameter that can be overriden to allow
explicit definition of the supported image types etc. that are supported for
the end user.  The underlying python representation per setting is an array of
tuples, however in puppet and hiera this is a hash as all options have an
order of 2.  A typical configuration may look like:

  horizon::image_backend:
    image_formats:
      '':    'Select image format'
      qcow2: 'QCOW2 - QEMU Emulator'
      raw:   'Raw'

Change-Id: Ieb92240ed86f67b73911ec627312093e797fa15f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-horizon refs/changes/48/236948/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*image_backend*] # (optional) Overrides the default image backend settings. This allows the list of supported # image types etc. to be explicitly defined. # Defaults to empty hash # $image_backend = {},

commit_message:
[Tech debt] Multiple floating ranges support

* Add 'objects.Release.is_multiple_floating_ranges_enabled' method.
* According to open/closed principle, move logic of 'generate_external_network'
  method to 'NeutronNetworkDeploymentSerializer80' and revert changes made in
  'NeutronNetworkDeploymentSerializer51'.
* Refactor and remove testing redundancy in 'TestNeutronDeploymentSerializer70'
  and 'TestNeutronDeploymentSerializer80'.

Change-Id: I993c22bf2ca65f8e3c01301c92e3f0987b403244
Partial-bug: #1490578

added_lines: def is_multiple_floating_ranges_enabled(cls, instance): """Check if usage of multiple floating ranges is available for release :param instance: a Release instance :returns: boolean """ return (StrictVersion(instance.environment_version) >= StrictVersion(consts.FUEL_MULTIPLE_FLOATING_IP_RANGES)) @classmethod

commit_message:
resource: define several option for all metric action

This makes sure it's pretty clear what we want to do. Because currently,
trying to attach+create a metric with an archive policy whose name is an
UUID fails.

Change-Id: Ib4ba6e59213464d5ea0cee6fc03e1b6f4728561c

commit_message:
[ovs] agent: postpone AMQP consumer declaration to as late as possible

This should allow us to avoid on the wire AMQP messages before we are
sure setup is correct, and also should allow us to fail gracefully on
bridge configuration issues without creating AMQP fanout queues that are
never cleaned up neither by the agent nor by AMQP brokers.

The idea of the patch is to declare topics only when we are ready to
connect consumers to those topics.

Note that RPC client calls would not trigger consumer declaration
because those are defined on connection objects that are not involved in
RPC call mechanism.

Change-Id: I982be11cab5351472b699d643c970ee7f18c5b35
Closes-Bug: #1505244
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/43/234343/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Setup AMQP only after all local scope setup is done, to avoid messing # with the broker until we are sure we'll successfully consume from the # queues that are to be created self.setup_rpc() self.init_extension_manager(self.connection) # NOTE(ihrachyshka): this will trigger declaration of all AMQP queues # defined for the connection report_interval = self.conf.AGENT.report_interval if report_interval: heartbeat = loopingcall.FixedIntervalLoopingCall( self._report_state) heartbeat.start(interval=report_interval) self.dvr_agent.setup_dvr_flows() self.context = context.get_admin_context_without_session() self.sg_agent = sg_rpc.SecurityGroupAgentRpc(self.context, self.sg_plugin_rpc, self.local_vlan_map, defer_refresh_firewall=True) self.dvr_agent = ovs_dvr_neutron_agent.OVSDVRNeutronAgent( self.context, self.dvr_plugin_rpc, self.int_br, self.tun_br, self.bridge_mappings, self.phys_brs, self.int_ofports, self.phys_ofports, self.patch_int_ofport, self.patch_tun_ofport, self.conf.host, self.enable_tunneling, self.enable_distributed_routing)
deleted_lines: self.setup_rpc() self.init_extension_manager(self.connection) self.dvr_agent = ovs_dvr_neutron_agent.OVSDVRNeutronAgent( self.context, self.dvr_plugin_rpc, self.int_br, self.tun_br, self.bridge_mappings, self.phys_brs, self.int_ofports, self.phys_ofports, self.patch_int_ofport, self.patch_tun_ofport, host, self.enable_tunneling, self.enable_distributed_routing) report_interval = self.conf.AGENT.report_interval if report_interval: heartbeat = loopingcall.FixedIntervalLoopingCall( self._report_state) heartbeat.start(interval=report_interval) if self.enable_tunneling: self.dvr_agent.setup_dvr_flows() # Security group agent support self.sg_agent = sg_rpc.SecurityGroupAgentRpc(self.context, self.sg_plugin_rpc, self.local_vlan_map, defer_refresh_firewall=True) # RPC network init self.context = context.get_admin_context_without_session()

commit_message:
Fix incorrect passing port dict in pluggable IPAM

_ipam_allocate_ips expects to receive port dict as a third argument, but
'changes' were passed instead.

This issue affects only third-party vendors who implement own IPAM
driver with custom AddressRequestFactory and uses port dict in it.

Updated arguments passed to _ipam_allocate_ips to include port dict as a
third argument.

Change-Id: I25eb86f46e5412cfacad9a751a94f7720f1a7bd0
Closes-Bug: #1511707
(cherry picked from commit 600a0db48a766437a91b427da8eeb3f066963db2)

added_lines: def _prepare_mocks(self, address_factory=None): if address_factory is None: address_factory = ipam_req.AddressRequestFactory mocks['driver'].get_subnet_request_factory.return_value = ( mocks['driver'].get_address_request_factory.return_value = ( address_factory) def _prepare_mocks_with_pool_mock(self, pool_mock, address_factory=None): mocks = self._prepare_mocks(address_factory=address_factory) @mock.patch('neutron.ipam.driver.Pool') def test_update_ips_for_port_passes_port_dict_to_factory(self, pool_mock): address_factory = mock.Mock() mocks = self._prepare_mocks_with_pool_mock( pool_mock, address_factory=address_factory) context = mock.Mock() new_ips = mock.Mock() original_ips = mock.Mock() mac = mock.Mock() ip_dict = {'ip_address': '192.1.1.10', 'subnet_id': uuidutils.generate_uuid()} changes = ipam_pluggable_backend.IpamPluggableBackend.Changes( add=[ip_dict], original=[], remove=[]) changes_mock = mock.Mock(return_value=changes) fixed_ips_mock = mock.Mock(return_value=changes.add) mocks['ipam'] = ipam_pluggable_backend.IpamPluggableBackend() mocks['ipam']._get_changed_ips_for_port = changes_mock mocks['ipam']._test_fixed_ips_for_port = fixed_ips_mock port_dict = {'device_owner': uuidutils.generate_uuid(), 'network_id': uuidutils.generate_uuid()} mocks['ipam']._update_ips_for_port(context, port_dict, original_ips, new_ips, mac) mocks['driver'].get_address_request_factory.assert_called_once_with() # Validate port_dict is passed into address_factory address_factory.get_request.assert_called_once_with(context, port_dict, ip_dict)
deleted_lines: def _prepare_mocks(self): mocks['driver'].get_subnet_request_factory = ( mocks['driver'].get_address_request_factory = ( ipam_req.AddressRequestFactory) def _prepare_mocks_with_pool_mock(self, pool_mock): mocks = self._prepare_mocks()

commit_message:
Few improvements in Kolla tools. Added Ubuntu support.

pip install default prefix in Ubuntu is /usr/local, and Kolla tools scripts
didnt respect that. So I added few OS checks in this scripts.

I improve config path check in build.py. Added more verbose error if we can't
find config directory.

Change-Id: Ide521ed205b0dc1fc27e237a9a8f4da0168e664f
Closes-Bug: #1512302
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/27/240827/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import platformdef find_os_type(): return platform.linux_distribution() if platform.linux_distribution()[0] == "Ubuntu": return '/usr/local/share/kolla' else: return '/usr/share/kolla' global_conf_path = os.path.join('/etc/kolla', filename) local_conf_path = os.path.join(find_base_dir(), 'etc', 'kolla', filename) if os.access(global_conf_path, os.R_OK): config_file = global_conf_path return config_file elif os.access(local_conf_path, os.R_OK): config_file = local_conf_path return config_file else: raise KollaDirNotFoundException( 'Cant find kolla config directory. Searched at: %s and %s' % (global_conf_path, local_conf_path) )
deleted_lines: return '/usr/share/kolla' filepath = os.path.join('/etc/kolla', filename) if os.access(filepath, os.R_OK): config_file = filepath else: config_file = os.path.join(find_base_dir(), 'etc', 'kolla', filename) return config_file

commit_message:
[Spec] Support IP ranges management for all networks

Related to blueprint ip-ranges-for-all-networks

Change-Id: I9e926cfb48f48f632b9b75460c228c4c970dd782
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-specs refs/changes/81/228381/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================================================== Provide the ability to specify IP ranges for all the networks on UI =================================================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/fuel/+spec/support-ip-ranges-for-storage-management-networks-on-ui It's often needed to specify ip ranges for storage and management network to use ip ranges with some omitted addresses which are reserved or already in use. -------------------- Problem description -------------------- When deploying an environment using Fuel it is often necessary to be able to specify IPs to be excluded from Fuel's auto-provisioning so that the deployment does not fail due to an IP already being assigned to or reserved for another resource but in current Fuel UI not all networks allow to do this (storage and management does not). With introducing this ability users could omit the IPs that are in use by setting the range to begin after or end before these IPs - in addition, multiple IP ranges can be specified, so for users who have an IP in use in the middle of their range, they can split the range to exclude the IP in use. ---------------- Proposed changes ---------------- Web UI ====== The change affects Fuel UI only. On Fuel UI on Networks tab it will be possible to specify ip ranges for all networks. The proposed change to Networks tab: .. image:: ../../images/8.0/ support-ip-ranges-for-storage-management-networks-on-ui/ip_ranges_networks.png So that existing Networks tab will be extended with new controls, adding ip ranges. Nailgun ======= None Data model ---------- None REST API -------- None Orchestration ============= None RPC Protocol ------------ None Fuel Client =========== None Plugins ======= None Fuel Library ============ None ------------ Alternatives ------------ None -------------- Upgrade impact -------------- None --------------- Security impact --------------- None -------------------- Notifications impact -------------------- None --------------- End user impact --------------- None ------------------ Performance impact ------------------ None ----------------- Deployment impact ----------------- Just after merge this change will let user to set ip ranges for all the networks provided. ---------------- Developer impact ---------------- None -------------------------------- Infrastructure/operations impact -------------------------------- None -------------------- Documentation impact -------------------- None -------------------- Expected OSCI impact -------------------- None -------------- Implementation -------------- Assignee(s) =========== Who is leading the writing of the code? Or is this a blueprint where you're throwing it out there to see who picks it up? If more than one person is working on the implementation, please designate the primary author and contact. Primary assignee: * Aleksandra Morozova (astepanchuk@mirantis.com) Mandatory design review: * Vitaly Kramskikh (vkramskikh@mirantis.com) Work Items ========== * Add ip range controls to Storage and Management networks Dependencies ============ None ------------ Testing, QA ------------ * Create a cluster and open Networks tab. It should be possible to provide ip ranges for all networks. Acceptance criteria =================== * Every network for which Fuel may allocate IP addresses must be in the ranges annotation so multiple range start and end points may be set ---------- References ---------- None

added_lines: # A simple sphinx plugin which creates HTML redirections from old names # to new names. It does this by looking for files named "redirect" in # the documentation source and using the contents to create simple HTML # redirection pages for changed filenames. # Stolen from openstack/nova-specs import os.path from sphinx.application import ENV_PICKLE_FILENAME from sphinx.util.console import bold def setup(app): from sphinx.application import Sphinx if not isinstance(app, Sphinx): return app.connect('build-finished', emit_redirects) def process_redirect_file(app, path, ent): parent_path = path.replace(app.builder.srcdir, app.builder.outdir) with open(os.path.join(path, ent)) as redirects: for line in redirects.readlines(): from_path, to_path = line.rstrip().split(' ') from_path = from_path.replace('.rst', '.html') to_path = to_path.replace('.rst', '.html') redirected_filename = os.path.join(parent_path, from_path) redirected_directory = os.path.dirname(redirected_filename) if not os.path.exists(redirected_directory): os.makedirs(redirected_directory) with open(redirected_filename, 'w') as f: f.write('<html><head><meta http-equiv="refresh" content="0; ' 'url=%s" /></head></html>' % to_path) def emit_redirects(app, exc): app.builder.info(bold('scanning %s for redirects...') % app.builder.srcdir) def process_directory(path): for ent in os.listdir(path): p = os.path.join(path, ent) if os.path.isdir(p): process_directory(p) elif ent == 'redirects': app.builder.info(' found redirects at %s' % p) process_redirect_file(app, path, ent) process_directory(app.builder.srcdir) app.builder.info('...done')

commit_message:
Execute mount.nfs check with absolute path

Currently the existence of mount.nfs is checked by executing
the relative binary 'mount.nfs' with a non-root user,
in this case cinder. This results, for example on SUSE, in the error:

      NfsException: mount.nfs is not installed

Because mount.nfs is located under /sbin, unprivileged users
do not have /sbin in their PATH to search for executables.
The change runs the mount.nfs check by using the absolute binary
path /sbin/mount.nfs. This seems to be common for most distributions
(SUSE, RedHat, CentOS, Ubuntu, Debian). The check can still be executed
as non privileged user, by not relying on correctly set PATH variable
and using the absolute path.

Change-Id: I3c1ecfdadd9ea492d58d69cbdf33045b002668c7
Closes-Bug: #1510150
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/17/239517/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Check if mount.nfs is installed on this system; note that we # need to be root, to also find mount.nfs on distributions, where # it is not located in an unprivileged users PATH (e.g. /sbin). run_as_root=True)
deleted_lines: # Check if mount.nfs is installed on this system; note that we don't # need to be root to see if the package is installed. run_as_root=False)

commit_message:
[packetary] Infrastructure improvments.

* Added retry for 404 (HTTP Status).
* Added method for downloading the file to the ConnectionManager.
* AsynchronousSection collects all exceptions with traceback and
     log it after all tasks has been completed.
* generator.gen_relation returns object instead of list
* GzipDecompress: fixed case when there is not enough data to decompress next chunk

Change-Id: Ie2014aeee0c4776ed411ef6f28a996ef2d029c95

commit_message:
Keystone Spelling Errors in docstrings and comments

Good Morning Keystone Tokyo. I wanted to give you guys an easy
review to do when you wake up.

I have noticed a few spelling errors in docstrings and comments
throughout keystone.  In this patch I fix all of the spelling
errors I could find.

Change-Id: I7233a6a7e1fc5c14c85049f362f03ea111704842
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/46/239946/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: SMBFS: Fix retrieving total allocated size
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-02-24 14:49:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/783392452ed31c44a7fd0747fc5129ddce7f87c8', 'message': 'SMBFS: Fix retrieving total allocated size

Currently, the Windows SMBFS driver parses all the VHD/X images
present on the configured share in order to retrieve the allocated
size. Not only that this can be slow when having many volumes, but
it can also fail in certain environements when the images are in use.

In order to avoid this, the driver can keep track of the allocated
size according to each share, the most basic solution being a JSON
stored in a file.

Change-Id: I14aa7b001605ae14fe0b6d0a45ee6b1abf8c4f60
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-02-24 14:51:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/015a75ddfe2305faaf0ac62bf30606d765be2967', 'message': 'SMBFS: Fix retrieving total allocated size

Currently, the Windows SMBFS driver parses all the VHD/X images
present on the configured share in order to retrieve the allocated
size. Not only that this can be slow when having many volumes, but
it can also fail in certain environements when the images are in use.

In order to avoid this, the driver can keep track of the allocated
size according to each share, the most basic solution being a JSON
stored in a file.

Closes-Bug: #1425100

Change-Id: I14aa7b001605ae14fe0b6d0a45ee6b1abf8c4f60
'}, {'number': 3, 'created': '2015-02-26 12:56:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/6935aba606eb455b391d3985bc8a0c7a7de84b8b', 'message': "SMBFS: Fix retrieving total allocated size

Currently, the Windows SMBFS driver parses all the VHD/X images
present on the configured share in order to retrieve the allocated
size. Not only that this can be slow when having many volumes, but
it can also fail in certain environements when the images are in use.

The Linux SMBFS driver uses 'du', which gives incorrect values in
case of VHD/X images.

In order to avoid this, the driver can keep track of the allocated
size according to each share, the most basic solution being a JSON
stored in a file.

As the Windows SMBFS driver inherits the Linux SMBFS driver, only
overwriting the os specific methods, the fix is applied to the base
SMBFS driver.

Closes-Bug: #1425100

Change-Id: I14aa7b001605ae14fe0b6d0a45ee6b1abf8c4f60

commit_message:
SMBFS: Fix retrieving total allocated size

Currently, the Windows SMBFS driver parses all the VHD/X images
present on the configured share in order to retrieve the allocated
size. Not only that this can be slow when having many volumes, but
it can also fail in certain environments when the images are in use.

The Linux SMBFS driver uses 'du', which gives incorrect values in
case of VHD/X images.

In order to avoid this, the driver can keep track of the allocated
size according to each share, the most basic solution being a JSON
stored in a file.

As the Windows SMBFS driver inherits the Linux SMBFS driver, only
overwriting the os specific methods, the fix is applied to the base
SMBFS driver.

DocImpact

Closes-Bug: #1425100

Change-Id: I14aa7b001605ae14fe0b6d0a45ee6b1abf8c4f60

commit_message:
[Reports] Add support of Jinja2 templates in ui.utils.get_template()

This patch starts switching UI templates to Jinja2 and makes
function rally.ui.utils.get_template() returning
jinja2.environment.Template, as well as already implemented
mako.template.Template.

Mako is used only if template file name ends with ".mako",
with deprecation warning.

Jinja templates will replace Mako templates in further patches.

Change-Id: Id12f1392414548c2465fd8c0a7a7ed20f4eeed6a

commit_message:
Pass correct auth_url to openstack::network class

auth_url should point to the public keystone port.
Use identity_uri for parameters which require admin endpoint

Closes-bug: #1503725
Change-Id: I2018f30f8a909d19bc1e8c87fbb061bcb599f8d3

commit_message:
bootstrap takes place on the wrong node

The bootstrap must occur on the nova-api node due to binding in the
nova-api directory (same goes for all other services)

Closes-Bug: #1513439
Backport: Liberty
Change-Id: Iab88b49712828085e4d7e7f85e6d8f0b7999a9bf

commit_message:
Restrucutre gate scripts

So we can respect DRY and share as much code as possible I have broken
out the common code between the aio and multinode gate scripts.

Additionally, this lays the ground work for removing our policy on
root-everywhere by using sudo. Once we get the non-root stuff worked
out we can gate as non-root user.

Change-Id: I781c597ab10f2296b95f51ae27e0fa617ffe0a66
Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate
(cherry picked from commit 3d7a0c6f55d5d4db33ff5ecb25466423e5d36b2d)

source build for openstack-base image.

commit_message:
Remove unused setup_fedora.sh

The Fedora code is no longer used and can be removed. Should it be needed in the
future the code is very similiar to CentOS. As is it will just become out of
date as the code is never excersied.

Change-Id: I7df832e5b0830ac8b4507f000ed8ed6e43d39463
Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate
(cherry picked from commit e4b84fbeacb892a47121541177af83b0117f91d7)

deleted_lines: #!/bin/bash set -o xtrace set -o errexit cat | sudo tee /etc/yum.repos.d/docker.repo << EOF [docker] name=Docker Main Repository baseurl=https://yum.dockerproject.org/repo/main/fedora/21 enabled=1 gpgcheck=1 gpgkey=https://yum.dockerproject.org/gpg EOF sudo yum install -y libffi-devel openssl-devel docker-engine-1.8.2 xfsprogs # Setup backing disk for use with Docker. This is to ensure we use the ephemeral # disk provided to the build instance. It ensures the correct disk and storage # driver are used for Docker. It is recommend to use the thin provisioning # driver. https://github.com/docker/docker/blob/master/man/docker.1.md sudo parted /dev/${DEV} -s -- mklabel msdos mkpart pri 1 -1 sudo pvcreate /dev/${DEV}1 sudo vgcreate kolla01 /dev/${DEV}1 sudo lvcreate -n thin01 -L 60G kolla01 sudo lvcreate -n thin01meta -L 2G kolla01 yes | sudo lvconvert --type thin-pool --poolmetadata kolla01/thin01meta kolla01/thin01 # Setup Docker sudo sed -i -r 's,(ExecStart)=(.+),\1=/usr/bin/docker daemon --storage-driver devicemapper --storage-opt dm.fs=xfs --storage-opt dm.thinpooldev=kolla01-thin01 --storage-opt dm.use_deferred_removal=true,' /usr/lib/systemd/system/docker.service sudo systemctl daemon-reload sudo systemctl start docker sudo docker info # disable ipv6 until we're sure routes to fedora mirrors work properly sudo sh -c 'echo "net.ipv6.conf.all.disable_ipv6 = 1" >> /etc/sysctl.conf' sudo /usr/sbin/sysctl -p echo "Completed $0."

commit_message:
Enable try_except_pass Bandit test

The try_except_pass test checks that pass isn't used in an except
block because it's the source of lots of security issues. The
current instances of pass in an except block are marked as nosec.

Change-Id: I73af6b80fa75286e96943026b7b71ad23dc1786b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/38/225738/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: except KeyboardInterrupt: except greenlet.GreenletExit: except greenlet.GreenletExit:

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-07-24 04:23:38.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/975673f7d5c0d38f2181e045b00bffe078937c1d', 'message': 'Remove "result" and "published" fields for task API

commit_message:
Remove "result" and "published" fields for task API

Currently the "/v2/tasks" API returns the "result" and "published" fields.
These fields can contain large amounts of data and this could have a big
impact on network and performance.

Change-Id: I0b4180d5ea119843542a121344dfb9653c54ab89
Closes-Bug: #1476610

networking-bagpipe: use 'Neutron stadium' ACLs

to match the access list of a neutron stadium project.

commit_message:
Fix /NetworkDriver.CreateEndpoint return value form

In current implementation, allocated port configuration is passed as
return value in interface description in both the cases:
1. remote network driver was supplied a non-empty value in Interface
2. remote network driver was supplied empty value in Interface
But for non-empty interface case, libnetwork expects empty values
of interface description fields which are passed non-empty value.
For example if input interface is:
        Interface': {
                u'AddressIPv6': u''
                u'MacAddress': u'',
                u'Address': u'172.18.0.2/16'
        },
In the response interface description, 'Address' MUST be empty. For
empty fields in request, accepted reponse values are both empty or
non-empty. If kuryr driver has allocated IP it should be sent back in
response, so that in 'docker inspect' output user can see kuryr
allocated IP.
But for non-empty field in request, only empty response
is considered success.

"If the remote process was supplied a non-empty value in Interface, it
must respond with an empty Interface value. LibNetwork will treat it
as an error if it supplies a non-empty value and receives a non-empty
value back, and roll back the operation."

Reference:
https://github.com/docker/libnetwork/blob/master/docs/remote.md#create-endpoint
https://github.com/docker/libnetwork/blob/master/drivers/remote/driver.go#L136

Change-Id: I0acce8c14457919f9a9ada5e728a71ca36db14e1
Closes-Bug: #1507895

commit_message:
Making instance_name_template configurable.

This will allow users to configure the value.
The parameter will be added only if required,
and exposed via heat templates.

instance_name_template is a template string
to be used to generate instance names.

commit_message:
Fix reference to puppetlabs/stdlib in Puppetfile

This commit fixes an erroneous reference to '4.x' branch, which does not
(or no longer) exists. Instead, it points it at 4.9.0, which is the
latest version advertised on the forge.

Change-Id: I2d04d7d10cbd2becde00fb2e21913b92f7b9dc03

commit_message:
Fix base ci test

using cephx without mon_initial_members appears to cause a bug where
ceph-create-keys runs, creates the keys, but doesn't add them to ceph auth.
Adding mon_initial_members resolves this issue.

Change-Id: I14e49c0c89449ef9a8bfdc630a172405c940fe6f

Run Ironic grenade jobs with IPA

bash ramdisk has been deprecated.

commit_message:
Read the response body, if response status is greater than 300.

internal_client was not reading response if response status is not 200.
So proxy server treats this as client disconnect and logs 499 in log file.
This patch fixes that by reading response if response status is greater
than or equal to 300 and in acceptable statuses.

Closes-Bug: #1364752

Change-Id: I0512a25895da583956f76031e3c5de5c970bce01

subject: Handle RequestURITooLong error in large instance table
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-07-29 13:55:33.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/d044bc90e9fe31a8305787862ed689ca341b9597', 'message': "Handle RequestURITooLong error in large instance table

Neutron API supports filtering in listing API. If long filter parameters
such as long UUID list are passed, it exceeds URL length limit and
RequestURITooLong is raised. In such case, we need to split filter
parameters into chunks.

This commit add a convenient method to handle the case, which split
a list of long filter parameter into chunks and repeat listing API call.
However, it is not easy to generalize this behavior because filtering
parameters are specific to caller's logic, so this patch only fixes
a problem in servers_update_addresses().

Change-Id: I63ec4bad722351f640797bcbec4a38d5972f135c
Closes-Bug: #1349841
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2015-01-28 00:17:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/test/api_tests/neutron_tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/test/api_tests/network_tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/api/neutron.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/horizon/commit/6e1da2634412afdb21fd5a3f27c1da1d332680f7', 'message': "Handle RequestURITooLong error in large instance table

commit_message:
Handle RequestURITooLong error in large instance table

Neutron API supports filtering in listing API. If long filter parameters
such as long UUID list are passed, it exceeds URL length limit and
RequestURITooLong is raised. In such case, we need to split filter
parameters into chunks.

This commit add a convenient method to handle the case, which split
a list of long filter parameter into chunks and repeat listing API call.
However, it is not easy to generalize this behavior because filtering
parameters are specific to caller's logic, so this patch only fixes
a problem in servers_update_addresses().

Change-Id: I63ec4bad722351f640797bcbec4a38d5972f135c
Closes-Bug: #1349841
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/91/110291/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutronclient.common import exceptions as neutron_excdef list_resources_with_long_filters(list_method, listed_field, **params): """List neutron resources with handling RequestURITooLong exception. If filter parameters are long, list resources API request leads to 414 error (URL is too long). For such case, this method split list parameters specified by a list_field argument into chunks and call the specified list_method repeatedly. :param list_method: Method used to retrieve resource list. :param listed_field: field name for which value list is specified in filter parameters. Only one field can be specified and the speicified value must be included in params. :param params: parameters to pass a specified listing API call. All parameters must be name based. Typically filter parameter to narrow resource list are also included. """ try: return list_method(**params) except neutron_exc.RequestURITooLong as uri_len_exc: # The URI is too long because of too many filter values. # Use the excess attribute of the exception to know how many # filter values can be inserted into a single request. value_list = params[listed_field] value_maxlen = max([len(str(v)) for v in value_list]) value_count = len(value_list) key_len = len(listed_field) # Length of a query filter on the speicified field # <key>=<value>& (e.g., id=<uuid>) # The length will be key_len + value_maxlen + 2 filter_len = key_len + value_maxlen + 2 # Maximum filter lenght which can be specified max_size = filter_len * value_count - uri_len_exc.excess chunk_size = max_size / filter_len resources = [] for i in range(0, value_count, chunk_size): params[listed_field] = value_list[i: i + chunk_size] data = list_method(**params) resources.extend(data) return resources LOG.warning("port_list(): params=%s" % (params)) ports = list_resources_with_long_filters( port_list, 'device_id', request=request, device_id=[instance.id for instance in servers]) floating_ips = list_resources_with_long_filters( FloatingIpManager(request).list, 'port_id', port_networks = set([port.network_id for port in ports]) networks = list_resources_with_long_filters( network_list, 'id', request=request, id=port_networks)
deleted_lines: LOG.debug("port_list(): params=%s" % (params)) ports = port_list(request, device_id=[instance.id for instance in servers]) floating_ips = FloatingIpManager(request).list( networks = network_list(request, id=[port.network_id for port in ports])

commit_message:
Add basic acceptance test

 - add case for Ubuntu repositories
 - add basic case for Murano installation

Change-Id: Id951fc5dc969d14d204a87ac8444286b734b6071
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-murano refs/changes/91/233591/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: require 'spec_helper_acceptance' describe 'basic murano' do context 'default parameters' do it 'should work with no errors' do pp= <<-EOS Exec { logoutput => 'on_failure' } # Common resources case $::osfamily { 'Debian': { include ::apt class { '::openstack_extras::repo::debian::ubuntu': release => 'liberty', repo => 'proposed', package_require => true, } $package_provider = 'apt' } 'RedHat': { class { '::openstack_extras::repo::redhat::redhat': manage_rdo => false, repo_hash => { 'openstack-common-testing' => { 'baseurl' => 'http://cbs.centos.org/repos/cloud7-openstack-common-testing/x86_64/os/', 'descr' => 'openstack-common-testing', 'gpgcheck' => 'no', }, 'openstack-liberty-testing' => { 'baseurl' => 'http://cbs.centos.org/repos/cloud7-openstack-liberty-testing/x86_64/os/', 'descr' => 'openstack-liberty-testing', 'gpgcheck' => 'no', }, 'openstack-liberty-trunk' => { 'baseurl' => 'http://trunk.rdoproject.org/centos7-liberty/current-passed-ci/', 'descr' => 'openstack-liberty-trunk', 'gpgcheck' => 'no', }, }, } package { 'openstack-selinux': ensure => 'latest' } $package_provider = 'yum' } default: { fail("Unsupported osfamily (${::osfamily})") } } class { '::mysql::server': } class { '::rabbitmq': delete_guest_user => true, package_provider => $package_provider, } rabbitmq_vhost { '/': provider => 'rabbitmqctl', require => Class['rabbitmq'], } rabbitmq_vhost { '/murano': provider => 'rabbitmqctl', require => Class['rabbitmq'], } rabbitmq_user { 'murano': admin => true, password => 'an_even_bigger_secret', provider => 'rabbitmqctl', require => Class['rabbitmq'], } rabbitmq_user_permissions { 'murano@/': configure_permission => '.*', write_permission => '.*', read_permission => '.*', provider => 'rabbitmqctl', require => Class['rabbitmq'], } rabbitmq_user_permissions { 'murano@/murano': configure_permission => '.*', write_permission => '.*', read_permission => '.*', provider => 'rabbitmqctl', require => Class['rabbitmq'], } # Keystone resources, needed by Sahara to run class { '::keystone::db::mysql': password => 'keystone', } class { '::keystone': verbose => true, debug => true, database_connection => 'mysql://keystone:keystone@127.0.0.1/keystone', admin_token => 'admin_token', enabled => true, } class { '::keystone::roles::admin': email => 'test@example.tld', password => 'a_big_secret', } class { '::keystone::endpoint': public_url => "https://${::fqdn}:5000/", admin_url => "https://${::fqdn}:35357/", } # Sahara resources class { '::murano::db::mysql': password => 'a_big_secret', } class { '::murano': admin_password => 'a_big_secret', rabbit_os_user => 'murano', rabbit_os_password => 'an_even_bigger_secret', rabbit_own_user => 'murano', rabbit_own_password => 'an_even_bigger_secret', rabbit_own_vhost => '/murano', database_connection => 'mysql://murano:a_big_secret@127.0.0.1/murano?charset=utf8', } class { '::murano::service::api': } class { '::murano::service::engine': } class { '::murano::keystone::auth': password => 'a_big_secret', } EOS # Run it twice and test for idempotency apply_manifest(pp, :catch_failures => true) apply_manifest(pp, :catch_changes => true) end describe port(8082) do it { is_expected.to be_listening.with('tcp') } end end end

commit_message:
add mongodb_replica_set option to ceilometer module

   This option sets name of the replica set
   which is used to connect to MongoDB database.

Change-Id: I6e5149d4f830677fc4bf3e363f7b999c0b06e399
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/11/238511/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*mongodb_replica_set*] # The name of the replica set which is used to connect to MongoDB # database. If it is set, MongoReplicaSetClient will be used instead # of MongoClient. # (Optional) Defaults to undef (string value). # $mongodb_replica_set = undef, if $mongodb_replica_set { ceilometer_config { 'database/mongodb_replica_set': value => $mongodb_replica_set; } } else { ceilometer_config { 'database/mongodb_replica_set': ensure => absent; } }

commit_message:
Use the absoluate path

Use the absoluate path rather than that with `..`. This will be
helpfull for end-user to see where is the folder/file.

Closes-Bug: #1513726
Change-Id: I7169952d874ddf14469605444044de0163b033d3
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/39/242339/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: return os.path.realpath(os.path.join(script_path, '..', '..'))

commit_message:
Add additional ntp information around ceph

Mention `chrony` since thats what docs.openstack.org recommends for
WAN connections. It does do better than ntpd
Change-Id: I28caade26492294bf12b092ff949003c7bf0bb8e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla refs/changes/58/236758/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: OpenStack, RabbitMQ, and Ceph require all hosts to have matching times to ensure proper message delivery. In the case of Ceph, it will complain if the hosts differ by more than 0.05 seconds. Some OpenStack services have timers as low as 2 seconds by default. For these reasons it is highly recommended to setup an NTP service of some kind. While `ntpd` will get you more accurate times if your NTP servers are running in your local environment, `chrony` is more accurate if you are syncing your time across a WAN connection. If you are running Ceph it is recommended to setup `ntpd` to sync your time with each other. To install, start, and enable ntp on CentOS execute the following:To install and start on Debian based systems execute the following: :: apt-get install ntp
deleted_lines: OpenStack uses healthcheck timers which run off wall-clock time rather then starting a timer and expring the timer, encoding the expiration in the message contents. In some cases, this timer interval can be on the order of 60 seconds. For OpenStack to Operate correctly with these tight health-check timer intervals, the Kolla community highly recommends running the ntpd service on all deployment targets. To install, start, and enable ntp on CentOS execute the following:

commit_message:
Remove mysql-devel cruft

This was conflicting with Percona-Server-devel-55 and broke centos
source build for openstack-base image.

Backport: Liberty
Change-Id: Ia2bb2106038e8e2eadb6668f4ae1ad1d95710c09
Closes-Bug: #1513711

commit_message:
Resolve the request API problem to Post V3/policy

Using the Sample Rest API of policy V3 version, we cannot create
Policy with the method of POST.

Insert the 'policy' dict and update the request like here, it worked!

Update CLI reference for python-ironicclient 0.10.0

This is autogenerated file.
This change adds three options for "ironic chassis-node-list"

Change-Id: Id154b006a8098b7aa8fd59caadecc886f4f6aa19

added_lines: <literal>0.10.0</literal>. [--maintenance <boolean>] [--associated <boolean>] [--provision-state <provision-state>] <varlistentry> <term><command>--maintenance <boolean></command></term> <listitem> <para> List nodes in maintenance mode: 'true' or 'false'. </para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term><command>--associated <boolean></command></term> <listitem> <para> List nodes by instance association: 'true' or 'false'. </para> </listitem> </varlistentry> <varlistentry> <term><command>--provision-state <provision-state></command></term> <listitem> <para> List nodes in specified provision state. </para> </listitem> </varlistentry>

subject: [config-ref] RST migration
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-11-05 11:19:29.000000000', 'files': ['specs/mitaka/config-ref-rst.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/docs-specs/commit/9492c898cd05393056a9ab6e7bc5e1f18281e032', 'message': '[config-ref] RST migration

Specification to convert the configuration reference to RST
implements: blueprint config-ref-rst

Change-Id: Ic5bfb9e5e0cc7ef1191f1d2a11ddf2b1ead67238
'}]
commit_message:
[config-ref] RST migration

Specification to convert the configuration reference to RST
implements: blueprint config-ref-rst

Change-Id: Ic5bfb9e5e0cc7ef1191f1d2a11ddf2b1ead67238
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/docs-specs refs/changes/98/241998/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode .. _config_ref_mitaka_rst: ======================================= Configuration Reference: RST conversion ======================================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+spec/config-ref-rst Convert the Configuration Reference from DocBook to RST. Problem description =================== The Configuration Reference will be converted from DocBook to RST for the Mitaka release. The tools generating the configuration options tables will be modified to generate RST tables instead of docbook tables. Proposed change =============== Convert the Configuration Reference to RST. Update the ``autohelp.py``, ``diff_branches.py`` and ``extract_swift_flags.py`` scripts to generate the configuration options tables. Alternatives ------------ None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: * gpocentek Work Items ---------- * Update the openstack-doc-tools scripts to support RST output. * Convert content from DocBook to RST. * Ensure bug fix proposals are included in DocBook and RST during the conversion process. * Track changes in wiki_. .. _wiki: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/Migrate * Update our build infrastructure so that Sphinx is used for publishing the Configuration Reference. * Apply the openstackdocstheme template to the guide. * Import translations from the old guide to the new guide. Dependencies ============ The main dependency is on docs.openstack.org infrastructure updates. Testing ======= * Test the new HTML design on the following browsers/operating systems: * Chrome on Ubuntu, Fedora, Mac, Windows * Firefox on Ubuntu, Fedora, Mac, Windows References ========== * Discussion can occur using any official medium including IRC in #openstack-doc, the openstack-docs mailing list with [config-ref] in the subject, weekly `documentation team meeting`_, and potentially etherpads. .. _`documentation team meeting`: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Meetings/DocTeamMeeting * `Migration wiki`_ .. _`Migration wiki`: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/Migrate

commit_message:
Monitor driver for k8s bay type

Add support for computing memory utilization of k8s bay

Change-Id: I3eecd5e9ceab77bb1877dff2229ba2eb18a5dd76
Closes-Bug: #1500299
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum refs/changes/17/234817/16 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import astfrom magnum.conductor import k8s_api as k8sclass K8sMonitor(MonitorBase): def __init__(self, context, bay): super(K8sMonitor, self).__init__(context, bay) self.data = {} self.data['nodes'] = [] self.data['pods'] = [] @property def metrics_spec(self): return { 'memory_util': { 'unit': '%', 'func': 'compute_memory_util', }, } def pull_data(self): import pdb;pdb.set_trace() self.bay.bay_uuid = self.bay.uuid k8s_api = k8s.create_k8s_api(self.context, self.bay) nodes = k8s_api.list_namespaced_node() self.data['nodes'] = self._parse_node_info(nodes) pods = k8s_api.list_pod() self.data['pods'] = self._parse_pod_info(pods) def compute_memory_util(self): mem_total = 0 for node in self.data['nodes']: mem_total += node['Memory'] mem_reserved = 0 for pod in self.data['pods']: mem_reserved += pod['Memory'] if mem_total == 0: return 0 else: return mem_reserved * 100 / mem_total def _parse_pod_info(self, pods): pods = pods.items parsed_containers = [] for pod in pods: containers = pod.spec.containers for container in containers: memory = 0 resources = container['resources'] limits = resources.limits if limits != None and limits.get('memory', ''): memory = limits['memory'][:-2] memory = float(memory) * 1024 * 1024 container_dict = { 'Memory': memory } parsed_containers.append(container_dict) def _parse_node_info(self, nodes): nodes = nodes.items parsed_nodes = [] for node in nodes: capacity = ast.literal_eval(node.status.capacity) memory = capacity['memory'][:-2] memory = float(memory) * 1024 parsed_nodes.append({'Memory': memory}) return parsed_nodes elif baymodel.coe == bay_type.KUBERNETES: return K8sMonitor(context, bay)

commit_message:
Resolved encoding/decoding problem.

In MIMEtext by default encodes in 'us-ascii'
for py27 and 'utf-8' in py34. So 'utf-8'
encoding is specified in argument.

Also in py27 constant string is already in unicode
type but in py34 it is byte type. So
string is decoded for py27 in unit test.

Partially-Implements: blueprint mistral-py3
Change-Id: I7004bae1d46d20630a30cac1abb65efe68765401

commit_message:
WIP: Add tempest run command to unified cli

This commit adds a 'tempest run' command to the unified tempest cli,
the next step in the new workflow for running tempest. After a local
working tempest directory is setup using the tempest init command you
then will use tempest run to run tempest from that working dir.

At this point the run command is very basic, and just exposes some
basic options. This interface will be grown over time to add more
features and include support for loading external tempest plugins.
But for right now this commit starts small and just adds a basic
interface for running and selecting tests, similar to what is
provided via our current use of tox.

Partially implements bp tempest-cli-improvements

Change-Id: Ib4a906db78bc7852f13874d72533300d26a0fb16
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/78/197378/8 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2015 Hewlett-Packard Development Company, L.P. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import subprocess from cliff import command from oslo_log import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) class TempestRun(command.Command): """Setup a local working environment for running tempest""" def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(TempestRun, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument('--smoke', '-s', action='store_true', help="Run the smoke tests only") parser.add_argument('--regex', '-r', help='A normal testr selection regex used to ' 'specify a subset of tests to run') parser.add_argument('--list-tests', '-l', action='store_true', help='Only List tests that would be run') return parser def list_tests(self, regex): pass def run_tests(self, regex): command = ['ostestr'] if regex: command.append('--regex', regex) subprocess.call(command) def take_action(self, parsed_args): if parsed_args.smoke: regex = 'smoke' elif parsed_args.regex: regex = parsed_args.regex else: regex = None if parsed_args.list_tests: self.list_tests(regex) else: self.run_tests(regex)

commit_message:
Add caching to neutron extensions

This adds a oslo.cache option for neutron extensions, and enable cache
in integration tests.

Change-Id: Ibbdc210dd57c3559f87789854b6b9b9159694cf2
Closes-Bug: #1512771

commit_message:
Fix example and test values for journal disks

* if providing an external journal disk, provide the disk and not
  the partition
* do not put things into /tmp

Change-Id: If6e4ae171d4339d06352108fcac3a27854c448b8

commit_message:
Pin the liberty branch to the liberty RPM repositories

The delorean trunk repositories point to the master
branches which is Mitaka since liberty was cut.

Closes-Bug: #1513628

commit_message:
Add unit tests for utils.validate_hash_path

This patch add some unit tests to prevent regression and to describe
validate_hash_path behavior, I found in review with

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/231864/

*bonus*
- Fix test_hash_path to use "with" syntax instead of "try/finally"
  for assigning a testing value into a global variable.

Change-Id: I948999a8fb8addb9a378dbf8bee853b205aeafad
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/05/231905/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from six.moves.configparser import NoSectionError, NoOptionError def test_validate_hash_path(self): # no section raise InvalidHashPathConfigError self._test_validate_hash_path(False, [], True) # has_section but no options raise InvalidHashPathConfigError self._test_validate_hash_path(True, [], True) # if we have the section and either of prefix or suffix, # InvalidHashPathConfigError doesn't occur self._test_validate_hash_path(True, ['swift_hash_path_prefix'], False) self._test_validate_hash_path(True, ['swift_hash_path_suffix'], False) # definitely, we have the section and both of them, # InvalidHashPathConfigError doesn't occur self._test_validate_hash_path( True, ['swift_hash_path_suffix', 'swift_hash_path_prefix'], False) def _test_validate_hash_path(self, has_section, options, raise_error): try: _prefix = utils.HASH_PATH_PREFIX _suffix = utils.HASH_PATH_SUFFIX utils.HASH_PATH_PREFIX = '' utils.HASH_PATH_SUFFIX = '' class FakeConfigParser(object): def read(self, conf_path): return True def get(self, section, option): if not has_section: raise NoSectionError('section error') elif option not in options: raise NoOptionError('option error', 'this option') else: return 'some_option_value' with mock.patch('swift.common.utils.ConfigParser', FakeConfigParser): try: utils.validate_hash_conf() except utils.InvalidHashPathConfigError: if not raise_error: self.fail('validate_hash_conf must raise an error') else: if raise_error: self.fail('validate_hash_conf must not raise an error') finally: utils.HASH_PATH_PREFIX = _prefix utils.HASH_PATH_SUFFIX = _suffix

commit_message:
bootstrap takes place on the wrong node

The bootstrap must occur on the nova-api node due to binding in the
nova-api directory (same goes for all other services)

Closes-Bug: #1513439
Backport: Liberty
Change-Id: Iab88b49712828085e4d7e7f85e6d8f0b7999a9bf

commit_message:
Allow disabling of sysctl values

The main reason for this change is to allow the DinD stuff to work. It
has limited use outside of that use case, but it may still be useful
to others in the future.

Change-Id: Ib3a4639cfb3fc0d378d33fc8b9ff8eb597f818ab
Partially-Implements: blueprint multinode-gate

Use oslo_config new type PortOpt for port options

The oslo_config library provides new type PortOpt to validate the
range of port now.

commit_message:
Expose versioning information on GET / endpoint

This returns 'min_version' (minimum supported version), 'version'
(current/maximum supported version), and 'status' (of the version,
is 'CURRENT' for v1) in the response to a GET / request.
It makes our response to / very close to Nova's one[0], and will allow
us to implement a `ironic version-list` command similar to Nova's.

As this change is needed for proper versioning support on client
side, it's not versioned itself. Otherwise we'll have a
chicken-and-egg problem.

[0]http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/nova-specs/specs/kilo/implemented/api-microversions.html#versioning

Closes-Bug: #1489172
Co-Authored-By: Ruby Loo <rloo@yahoo-inc.com>
Change-Id: I6dd1ea20e23137d9a9566355adc0784067d2cb5b

commit_message:
Fix to disable meter-links on resource-list CLI

This adds an optional param to resource-list
CLI to disable meter-links. By default its
False to maintain backward compatibility.

A different patch for the same issue has been
done on master since master has meter-links
disabled by default, whereas on kilo, its enabled
by default.

see: I308b94c8a57833cf30b4815ecec2ff9a50e91af6

Closes-Bug: #1508708

Change-Id: I6f3fa6f485a604d8b027486795a0865327acfcd6
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-ceilometerclient refs/changes/54/238654/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: @utils.arg('--disable-meter-links', dest='links', metavar='{True|False}', type=strutils.bool_from_string, default=False, help='True if meter links should not be generated.') resources = cc.resources.list(q=options.cli_to_array(args.query), links=not args.links)

commit_message:
Change tests to accept 400 or 422

The behavior tested here is different between the java
and python and is not easily reconcilable.

commit_message:
Allow customization of db sync command line

Add parameter to ceilometer::db::sync class to allow end
users to add command line parameters to the db sync command.

Change-Id: I664a822ef2962d5cb32bef7573e13f0b57ee6057
Partial-bug: #1472740
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceilometer refs/changes/76/241276/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :command => 'ceilometer-dbsync --config-file=/etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf ', describe 'overriding extra_params' do let :params do { :extra_params => '--config-file=/etc/ceilometer/ceilometer_01.conf', } end it { is_expected.to contain_exec('ceilometer-dbsync').with( :command => 'ceilometer-dbsync --config-file=/etc/ceilometer/ceilometer.conf --config-file=/etc/ceilometer/ceilometer_01.conf', :path => '/usr/bin', :user => 'ceilometer', :refreshonly => 'true', :logoutput => 'on_failure' ) } end

commit_message:
DVR: only notify needed agents on new VM port creation

When a new VM which should be serviced by a DVR router appears
on compute host, this router is scheduled to that host and
notification is sent. Before the patch it was a broad notification
while really we only need to notify agent on target host.
This should decrease the load on neutron server at scale.

Closes-Bug: #1486795
Change-Id: Id48b6f6a71530c4f6092d2a07b2db1a5cd300c05
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/55/231555/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def check_l3_agent_router_binding(self, context, router_id, agent_id): query = context.session.query(RouterL3AgentBinding) bindings = query.filter_by(router_id=router_id, l3_agent_id=agent_id).all() return bool(bindings)

commit_message:
Upgrade to Swarm 1.0.0 (production ready release)

Docker Inc announced Swarm 1.0: Production-ready release
(https://blog.docker.com/2015/11/swarm-1-0/)

Closes-Bug: #1513661

subject: Support for services different only by type.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2015-10-23 15:01:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-keystone/commit/888ed7380826833e6c994c07db2fdcf44e3425ec', 'message': "Support for services different only by type.

Keystone_service provider was not able to create service different by
type.  So service type computev3 and compute with name nova could not be
created.

Second, on a system with such resource it would not be able to
differentiate between the two.  Then if

   keystone_service {'nova': type => 'compute'}

was in the catalog, then the service nova/computev3 would be changed to
nova/compute.

Now you can specify:

   keystone_service {'service::type'}

or

   keystone_service {'service': type => 'type'}

It keeps a full backward compatibility.

commit_message:
Support for services different only by type.

First, Keystone_service provider was not able to create service
different by type.  So service type computev3 and compute with name nova
could not be created.

Second, on a system with such resource it would not be able to
differentiate between the two.  Then if

   keystone_service {'nova': type => 'compute'}

was in the catalog, then the service nova/computev3 would be changed to
nova/compute.

Now you can specify:

   keystone_service {'service::type'}

or

   keystone_service {'service': type => 'type'}

It keeps a full backward compatibility.

Change-Id: I24bbcf8cbf3760fd061e2439f37864ae97ce86f6
Closes-Bug: #1508886

added_lines: require 'spec_helper' require 'puppet' require 'puppet/type/keystone_service' describe Puppet::Type.type(:keystone_service) do let(:project) do Puppet::Type.type(:keystone_service).new( :id => 'blah', :name => 'foo', :type => 'foo-type' ) end it 'should not accept id property' do expect { project }.to raise_error(Puppet::Error, /This is a read only property/) end describe 'service::type' do include_examples 'parse title correctly', :name => 'service', :type => 'type' end describe 'new_service_without_type' do include_examples 'croak on the required parameter' end describe 'new_service_with_type_as_parameter' do include_examples 'succeed with the required parameters', { :type => 'type' } end end

commit_message:
Remove vip for rabbitmq

Adjust all the configs to list all the rabbitmq hosts rather than
running rabbitmq through the VIP. This is made possible by clusterer
which has already merged.

Change-Id: I5db48f5f10ec68f4c8863a29bc13984f6845a4f9
Partially-Implements: blueprint rabbitmq-clusterer

commit_message:
DNM: Add bdm_field_is_new() to BlockDeviceMapping

This lets us see if a field has been newly set, as opposed to just
changed.

Change-Id: I7a60d00c13911d0dd5a74514fd0da8939a80b936
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/37/241737/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, *a, **k): super(BlockDeviceMapping, self).__init__(*a, **k) self._reset_tracking() def _reset_tracking(self): self._orig_fields = {} for field in self.fields: if self.obj_attr_is_set(field): self._orig_fields[field] = getattr(self, field) def obj_reset_changes(self, fields=None, recursive=False): super(BlockDeviceMapping, self).obj_reset_changes(fields=fields, recursive=recursive) self._reset_tracking() def bdm_field_is_new(self, field): return self.obj_attr_is_set(field) and field not in self._orig_fields

commit_message:
Implement /NetworkDriver.Join for ovs

This patch implements /NetworkDriver.Join for ovs and it also fixes
port status of 'unbound' problem.

Change-Id: I7bee2339e195909acfd8d99bf254f8761c2fd6e4
Signed-off-by: Pengfei Ni <feiskyer@gmail.com>

Allow 'allocation_pools' updatable for neutron subnet

subnet resource.

commit_message:
Add new context manager for shade exceptions, cont.

This commit continues the work of
 change Ic39b6e3efc33b7a30f298a3daca6d6c16ab4ca89

Shade has developed a common pattern within many of the API
methods where we try to avoid re-wrapping OpenStackClientException
exceptions by catching them and simply re-raising. We can eliminate
this duplicate exception handling with a context manager.

Change-Id: Ifd97181b33ed72bb9ad5b3da1e2b92a660e12a65

deleted_lines: try: except OpenStackCloudException: raise except Exception as e: raise OpenStackCloudException( "Error updating machine via patch operation. node: %s. " "%s" % (name_or_id, str(e))) try: except OpenStackCloudException: raise except Exception as e: raise OpenStackCloudException( "Machine update failed - patch operation failed Machine: %s " "Error: %s" % (name_or_id, str(e))) try: except OpenStackCloudException: raise except Exception as e: raise OpenStackCloudException(str(e)) try: except OpenStackCloudException: raise except Exception as e: raise OpenStackCloudException( "Baremetal machine node failed change provision" " state to {state}: {msg}".format(state=state, msg=str(e)))

commit_message:
Disable the RGW acceptance test

In order to fix the CI we need to disable the RGW acceptance test for
now.

Change-Id: I8ab6607614fbccd0eaf88abebb54f530f27ddb77
Co-Authored-By: David Gurtner <aldavud@crimson.ch>
Related-Bug: #1513616
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-ceph refs/changes/17/242217/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # RGW on CentOS is currently broken, so lets disable tests for now. if osfamily != 'RedHat' apply_manifest(pp, :catch_failures => true) # Enable as soon as remaining changes are fixed #apply_manifest(pp, :catch_changes => true) shell servicequery[osfamily] do |r| expect(r.exit_code).to be_zero end shell "swift -V 2.0 -A http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0 -U #{test_tenant}:#{test_user} -K #{test_password} stat" do |r| expect(r.exit_code).to be_zero expect(r.stdout).to match(/Content-Type: text\/plain; charset=utf-8/) expect(r.stdout).not_to match(/401 Unauthorized/) end osfamily = fact 'osfamily' # RGW on CentOS is currently broken, so lets disable tests for now. if osfamily != 'RedHat' apply_manifest(purge, :catch_failures => true) end
deleted_lines: apply_manifest(pp, :catch_failures => true) # Enable as soon as remaining changes are fixed #apply_manifest(pp, :catch_changes => true) shell servicequery[osfamily] do |r| expect(r.exit_code).to be_zero end shell "swift -V 2.0 -A http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0 -U #{test_tenant}:#{test_user} -K #{test_password} stat" do |r| expect(r.exit_code).to be_zero expect(r.stdout).to match(/Content-Type: text\/plain; charset=utf-8/) expect(r.stdout).not_to match(/401 Unauthorized/) apply_manifest(purge, :catch_failures => true)

commit_message:
Bump ironicclient depend

ironicclient 0.10.0 drops the lxml requirement. Let's set the min in
shade to that so that we make sure people don't try to install lxml.

Change-Id: I942de581e15017de9706cabd2eb759eec578565e
Depends-On: I6f0e5d7f3d97a5fb6a948d653633b067dfe258f7

commit_message:
devstack: Update URL for appliance image to tarballs.o.o

This points devstack to download and dogfood our own auto-built
appliance image that is rebuilt with every commit to akanda-appliance.

Change-Id: Iab9f44c72c4468c77a370f5cd870895e1c51d4a0

commit_message:
cleanup of emc-vnx-driver xml file

changed avoid to avoids - made plural
added the where necessary
changed computer node to compute node
changed vm to VM
changed tht to that - typo
corrected run on sentences
added hyphen when necessary to comply w/rest of doc

Change-Id: Ia533376b08aa7da3d46dcba401ddf5f6852a3e2a

added_lines: This approach avoids the plain text password in your cinder <para>For the FC Driver, add the following option:</para> <literal>io_port_list</literal>, the driver will only register the The driver will raise an exception if ports in storage group's name). All the volumes attached to the VM instances in a compute node will be put into the storage group. The EMC VNX FC driver supports FC SAN auto zoning when ZoneManager Extra specs are used in volume types created in cinder as the preferred property of the volume. The Block storage scheduler will use extra specs to find the suitable back end for the volume and the Block storage driver will create the volume based on the properties specified by the extra spec. <title>Snap-copy</title> The VNX driver supports snap-copy, which extremely accelerates the created through the snap-copy before it is converted to a full When the driver notices that there is no existing storage group
